questions.question: I met them ............................. I was holidaying in Canada.
questions.description: While is a conjunction. We use it before a clause.

questions.question: I met them .............................. my last holiday in Canada.
questions.description: During is a preposition. We use it before a noun.

questions.question: Janet called .................................. you were out.
questions.description: We use while before a clause.

questions.question: She said that she is not responsible for anything that happened .................................. her absence.
questions.description: We use during before a preposition.

questions.question: I fell asleep ................................ I was reading the book.
questions.description: We use a clause after while.

questions.question: We had a lot of strange experiences ............................. our vacation in America.
questions.description: We use a preposition after during.

questions.question: ............................. holidaying in Melbourne, Jerry acquired a strong Australian accent.
I was in Mumbai .......................... the winter.
I will try to meet you ............................. my trip to California.
questions.description: Use during before a noun/noun phrase.

questions.question: Can I see you for a few minutes .............................. the afternoon?
questions.description: Either during or in can be used to talk about the whole of the period.

questions.question: I don't like to answer calls ................................. I am driving.
The school was closed ............................. the whole of April.
